title: Google | SWE3 / L4 | Hyderabad
content:
Education: BE from Tier-3
Years of Experience: 4
Prior Experience: Software Engineer in a Service Based Company, Remote
Current TC: 18lpa

Date of the Offer: Aug 2024
Company: Google
Title/Level: SWE-3 / L4
Location: Hyderabad
Base Salary: 35lpa
Relocation Bonus: 4lpa - one time
Signing Bonus: 7lpa - one time
Stock bonus: 100K USD for 4 years (38%, 32%, 20%, 10%)
Bonus: 15% Base
Total comp (Salary + Bonus + Stock): ~ 85lpa(for 1st year)
Benefits - 2.8lpa (PF + Gratuity + Insurance)
Other details:  No Negotiation. Did not have any competing offers. Accepted the offer.

I will add the interview experience soon.

title: Goldman Sachs (Asset Management Engineering) | New Analyst (PPO) | Bengaluru
content:
Education: Tier 1 IIIT
Years of Experience: 0
Prior Experience: 2 month internship at GS
Date of the Offer: July 2024
Company: Goldman Sachs
Title/Level: New Analyst
Location: Bengaluru
Salary: 19.5 LPA base
Relocation/Signing Bonus: 6 Lakh
Stock bonus: NA
Performance Bonus: 4.5 Lakh
Total comp (Salary + Bonus + Stock): 30 LPA
Other details: Had a stipend of 1 Lakh per Month while interning, got a PPO

Question: I personally had a good experience at the firm and felt the WLB for my team and department is very good. Do you think the compensation is good or am I being lowballed and I should try for more companies? If yes, which ones do you suggest?

title: Goldman Sachs | Associate | Bengaluru (India)
content:
Education: MTech(CSE) from Tier-1
Years of Experience: 5

Current Company: Oracle
Location: Bengaluru (Currently WFH from hometown)
Title/Level: SDE-2
Current Comp: 28L base + 3 L joining bonus (first year + second year) + 12.5L RSU every year
	1st year (Base + JB + RSU): 28L + 3L + 12.5L = 43.5L
	2nd year (Base + JB + RSU): 28L + 3L + 12.5L = 43.5L
	3rd year (Base + RSU): 28L + 12.5L = 40.5L


**Offer details**
Company: Goldman Sachs
Location: Bengaluru (5 days in work from office) - need to relocate
Title: Associate
offered salary: 35L Base + undisclosed yearly performance based bonus. (according to HR - I can consider 5-7L annual bonus)
Relocation: 1L
Signing Bonus: No
RSU: No
Other: Agreed to comp off the lose of first year JB (3L) and 12.5L for Oracle RSU which will vest after few months. 

Total comp:
	1st year (Base + pro-rata annual Bonus + Relocation + first year RSU and JB comp-off): 35L + 1L + 1L + 15L = 52L
	2nd year (Base + annual Bonus) - considering 6L bonus in avg case :  35L + 6 = 41L
	3rd year (Base + annual Bonus) - considering 6L bonus in avg case :  35L + 6 = 41L


Plz help me to evaluate/negotiate this offer... I do not have any other offer in hand.
Thanks.

title: Microsoft | L60 | Hyderabad [Offer Evaluation]
content:
Education: B.Tech in CSE
Years of Experience: 3
Prior Experience: Product Based Indian Startup
Previous Compensation - Rs.24L Fixed + Rs.5L Stocks over 4 years
Counter Offer - From MNC - Rs.32L Fixed + Rs.5L Bonus + Rs.5L Stocks over 3 years
Date of the Offer: August 2024
Level : L60
Company: Microsoft
Title/Level: Software Engineer
Location: Hyderabad, India
Salary:  Rs. 25,00,000
Relocation: Rs. 1,50,000
Signing Bonus: Rs 3,00,000 in the 1st year and Rs.2,00,000 in the 2nd year
Stock bonus: $60K stock grant vested over 4 years
Bonus: Performance-based bonus up to 20% of base salary every year (Target 10%) - Rs.2,50,000
Total comp (Salary + Bonus + Stock): ~Rs.85L, ~Rs.44L in 1st Year
Benefits:  Standard Microsoft Benefits

Is this a good offer given that I've 3 YOE? I know it's in the upper range of L60.

title: PayPal I SE-3 I 48 LPA TC | 5 yoe
content:
5 years experience

Previous Compensation: 25.8 LPA base + 3.6 lac bonus (one time, due) = 29.4 LPA

Date of the Offer: Aug 2024
**Company: PayPal**
Title/Level: SE3 / Senior SE / T24
Location: Chennai ,India
Salary: INR 32,00,000 (Base)
Variable Bonus: INR 3,20,000 (10% of Base)
Relocation Bonus: NA
Joining Bonus: NA
Stock bonus: 15,000$ - (INR 12.6 lakh) per year for 3 years (3 year vesting)
Total Compensation: 32 (Base) + 3.2 (Variable) + 12.6 (Stock) = 47.8 LPA

No competitive offer.
How are the above numbers? Please suggest tips to negotiate.
